body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky The undersigned Petitioner respectfully represents that at the March Term of the Laurel Circuit Court 1864 The Grand Jury for said County returned an Indictment against him for failing to keep up Tavern within his tavern house, being advised that such failure was a violation of law he at once entered his appearance and plead guilty to the charge and the law & facts being submitted to the court. Judgment was rendered against him for the sum of seventy five dollars. He states that by such failure he had no intention whatever of violating or evading the laws of the county, in fact he did not know that such failure was a violation of law.
Wherefore he prays Your Excellency to remit said Judgment
Sworn to before me by John Pitman 25th March 1864

We the undersigned citizens of Laurel County are well acquainted with John Pitman who is a law abdiding good citizen and one of those men who never intentionally evades or violates the Laws, we have every reason to believe his statements above are true and pray your excellency to remit said Judgment

C B Davis
Wm T. Moren
R. Boyd
Granville Pearl
Mark Hardin
R Baird
James Jackson
W P Evans
A. B. King

Laurel Cir Ct

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
